Political Agency, Bahrain, 31st January 1944 To The Adviser to the Government of Bahrain Bahrain. MEMORANDUM Reference your memorandum No.194-24 of the 25th of January 1944. 2. According to the law of India every person domiciled in British India who has not completed the age of 18 years is a minor. In the case hov/ever of a person for whom or for whose property a guardian has been appointed (Court of Wards) the age of majority is deemed to have attained on the minor attaining the age of 21 years. 3. Shopkeepers are not restricted from supplying goods to minors on credit but minors are not liable in law for the debts thus incurred. Courts of Wards are however liable for their charges. Persons of unsound mind, so certified by a Court or otherwise according to the law in force, are not liable in law for debts incurred. 4. I suggest that the Court of Wards should publish a dis claimer of responsibility for the debts incurred by minors and persons who are mentally unsound and whose property is being administered by them. The personSshould be named in the dis claimer. With regard to persons who although of age are in your opinion unfit to deal with their affairs I regret I can give you no assistance, for, according to the law of India and England every adult is entitled to have full charge of his personal property provided he has not bten certified as insane or a Court Order recorded that he is mentally unsound. Political Agent, Bahrain.

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-6; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains the following:Correspondence between Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, and Tom Hickinbotham, Political Agent, Bahrain, regarding the legal specifics surrounding those whose estates in Bahrain are administered by the government due to their age or mental state, including their liability for any debts incurred through use of credit;a public notice issued by the government listing all those whose estates are administered by the Minors Department who are not legally liable for their debts.Folio 7 is internal office notes.
